content:
ActivityDesignerAccessibleObject Class

Definition

Implements an accessible object that ActivityDesigner classes use to adjust the designer user interface for users who have impairments.

In this Article

[System.Obsolete("The System.Workflow.* types are deprecated.  Instead, please use the new types from System.Activities.*")]
public class ActivityDesignerAccessibleObject : System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleObject
Inheritance
Object
MarshalByRefObject
StandardOleMarshalObject
System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleObject
ActivityDesignerAccessibleObject

Value

Remarks

Note

This material discusses types and namespaces that are obsolete. For more information, see Deprecated Types in Windows Workflow Foundation 4.5.

Constructors

ActivityDesignerAccessibleObject(ActivityDesigner)

Initializes a new instance of the ActivityDesignerAccessibleObject class by using the specified ActivityDesigner.

public ActivityDesignerAccessibleObject (System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner activityDesigner);
activityDesigner
ActivityDesigner

The ActivityDesigner which to apply the accessible object.

Properties

ActivityDesigner

Gets the ActivityDesigner to which the accessible object is applied.

protected System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner ActivityDesigner { get; }
Value
ActivityDesigner

The ActivityDesigner to which the accessibility object is applied.

Bounds

Gets the location and size of the accessible object.

public override System.Drawing.Rectangle Bounds { get; }
Value
Rectangle

A Rectangle that represents the bounds of the accessible object.

DefaultAction

Gets a string that describes the default action of the activity designer.

public override string DefaultAction { get; }
Value
String

A description of the default action associated with the activity designer, or a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic) if the object has no default action.

Remarks

This property is displayed on the designer surface for users with impairments. Not all activity designers have a default action.

Description

Gets a string that describes the visual appearance of the activity designer.

public override string Description { get; }
Value
String

A description of the activity designer's visual appearance, or a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic) if the object has no description.

Remarks

This property is displayed on the designer surface for users with impairments. Not all activity designers have a description.

Help

Gets a description of what the activity associated with the activity designer does or how it is used.

public override string Help { get; }
Value
String

A string that contains the description of what the activity associated with the activity designer does or how it is used, or a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic) if no help is defined.

Name

Gets or sets the name of the Activity associated with the accessible object's ActivityDesigner.

public override string Name { get; set; }
Value
String

The name of the Activity or a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic) if the property has not been set.

Remarks

The Name property is a string used by clients to identify, find, or announce an activity for the user. To access the name of a child activity, you must first call GetChild with the index of the name of the child activity you are retrieving.

You cannot perform a set operation on Name.

Parent

Gets the parent of the ActivityDesignerAccessibleObject.

public override System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleObject Parent { get; }
Value
System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleObject

The AccessibleObject that represents the parent of the current ActivityDesignerAccessibleObject or a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic) if there it no parent accessible object.

Role

Gets the role of the current ActivityDesignerAccessibleObject.

public override System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleRole Role { get; }
Value
AccessibleRole

One of the AccessibleRole values, or AccessibleRole if no role has been specified.

Remarks

A graphical image used to diagram data can be obtained using the AccessibleRole member of AccessibleRole.

State

Gets the accessible state of the current ActivityDesignerAccessibleObject.

public override System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleStates State { get; }
Value
AccessibleStates

A combination of AccessibleStates values.

Remarks

State has the following possible values:

AccessibleStates, AccessibleStates, AccessibleStates, AccessibleStates, AccessibleStates, AccessibleStates, AccessibleStates, and AccessibleStates.

Methods

DoDefaultAction()

Performs the default action associated with the ActivityDesignerAccessibleObject.

public override void DoDefaultAction ();

Remarks

Clients can retrieve the designer's default action by using DefaultAction.

GetService(Type)

Returns the service defined by the specified type that is associated with the ActivityDesigner.

protected object GetService (Type serviceType);
serviceType
Type

The service Type to request.

Returns
Object

An Object that represents the requested service, or a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic) if the service cannot be resolved.

Navigate(AccessibleNavigation)

Returns the AccessibleObject associated with the location defined by the specified AccessibleNavigation.

public override System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleObject Navigate (System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleNavigation navdir);
navdir
AccessibleNavigation

One of the AccessibleNavigation values.

Returns
System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleObject

The AccessibleObject at the specified location.

Select(AccessibleSelection)

Modifies the selection or moves the keyboard focus of the ActivityDesignerAccessibleObject.

public override void Select (System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleSelection flags);
flags
AccessibleSelection

One of the AccessibleSelection values.
